name: Ludwigia humboldtiana
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.470.1.3 The specific epithet is a tribute to the German explorer, geographer and naturalist Friedrich Wilhelm Heinrich Alexander von Humboldt (1769–1859), who was previously honoured by the name Hansa Humboldt, the original name of Corupá, the Brazilian municipality where the new species, according to the best of evidence, is restricted to.

name: Ludwigia irregularis
distribution: Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America);Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.520.3.4 The specific epithet is a reference to the irregular number of petals, an uncommon characteristic for Ludwigia, specially in section Myrtocarpus, in which all other species have four petals.
